snippet: Israeli prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu made his first major move against the settlement movement since he vastly expanded his power in a new coalition last month.
abstract: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel seems headed for a showdown with hard-core Jewish settlers, after his ministers follow his instructions to vote against a draft bill that would have retroactively legalized illegally built homes in the West Bank; bill paves the way for the imminent removal of five apartment buildings housing about 30 families; enraged settlers protest in Jerusalem.
lead_paragraph: Israeli prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu made his first major move against the settlement movement since he vastly expanded his power in a new coalition last month.

headline.seo: Israeli Settler Homes Not Legalized by Parliament
headline.main: Netanyahu Ministers Reject Move to Legalize Some Settler Homes
headline.print_headline: A Setback in the Israeli Parliament for Settlers
